name: Toolbar
classdesc:
JET Toolbar

Description: A toolbar displays a strip of control elements such as buttons and menu buttons, often grouped by separators.

<oj-c-toolbar items="[[toolbarItems]]">
</oj-c-toolbar>

Touch End User Information

Keyboard End User Information

Target Gesture Action
Navigate right Right Arrow Key or Left Arrow Key(RTL) Change focus to next item on the right
Navigate left Left Arrow Key or Right Arrow Key(RTL) Change focus to next item on the left

Accessibility

JET Toolbar takes care of focus management, as noted above.

The application is responsible for applying aria-label and/or aria-controls attributes to the toolbar element, if applicable per the instructions that follow:

If this toolbar is (or might be) placed in context with other toolbars, then the application should apply an aria-label to the toolbar element to distinguish it, e.g. an "Edit" toolbar. The aria-label is optional when there is only one toolbar.

If the toolbar is controlling something else on the page, e.g. bold / italic / underline buttons controlling a rich text editor, then the application should apply an aria-controls attribute to the toolbar element, e.g. aria-controls="myTextEditor".

Disabled content: JET supports an accessible luminosity contrast ratio, as specified in WCAG 2.0 - Section 1.4.3 "Contrast", in the themes that are accessible. (See the "Theming" chapter of the JET Developer Guide for more information on which themes are accessible.) Note that Section 1.4.3 says that text or images of text that are part of an inactive user interface component have no contrast requirement. Because disabled content may not meet the minimum contrast ratio required of enabled content, it cannot be used to convey meaningful information.

tstype.value: interface CToolbarElement extends JetElement<ToolbarElementSettableProperties>

name: spacing
description: Specifies the spacing between content. 'sm' spacing is recommended for button variants that don't have a background or border, for example borderless buttons. 'lg' spacing is recommended for button variants that have a background or border, for example outlined or solid buttons.

ojvalues.name: sm
ojvalues.description: Compact spacing between content.

ojvalues.name: lg
ojvalues.description: Default spacing between content.

name: chroming
description: Specifies the chroming to be set on content to be placed into the toolbar.

name: size
description: Specifies the size of content to be placed into the toolbar.

name: items
description: Specifies the content to be placed into the toolbar.

tstype.value: Array<oj-c.Toolbar.ToolbarButton|oj-c.Toolbar.ToolbarMenuButton|oj-c.Toolbar.ToolbarSplitMenuButton|oj-c.Toolbar.ToolbarButtonsetSingle|oj-c.Toolbar.ToolbarButtonsetMultiple|oj-c.Toolbar.ToolbarToggleButton|oj-c.Toolbar.ToolbarProgressButton|oj-c.Toolbar.ToolbarSeparator>

name: toolbarSelection
description: An array containing key/value objects for selection groups.

tstype.value: Readonly<Record<string, ToolbarSelection>>

name: setProperty
description: Sets a property or a single subproperty for complex properties and notifies the component of the change, triggering a corresponding event.

params.name: property
params.description: The property name to set. Supports dot notation for subproperty access.

params.name: value
params.description: The new value to set the property to.

name: getProperty
description: Retrieves the value of a property or a subproperty.

params.name: property
params.description: The property name to get. Supports dot notation for subproperty access.

name: setProperties
description: Performs a batch set of properties.

params.name: properties
params.description: An object containing the property and value pairs to set.

name: ojToolbarAction
description: Triggered when a toolbar item is clicked, whether by keyboard, mouse, or touch events. Detail indicates which toolbar item was clicked.

name: ojToolbarSelection
description: Triggered when a toolbar selection group item is clicked, whether by keyboard, mouse, or touch events. Detail indicates new selection value for group.

tstype.value: T

name: touchDoc
description:
Target Gesture Action
Navigate right Right Arrow Key or Left Arrow Key(RTL) Change focus to next item on the right
Navigate left Left Arrow Key or Right Arrow Key(RTL) Change focus to next item on the left

name: keyboardDoc
description:
Target Gesture Action
Navigate right Right Arrow Key or Left Arrow Key(RTL) Change focus to next item on the right
Navigate left Left Arrow Key or Right Arrow Key(RTL) Change focus to next item on the left

name: ToolbarButton
description: Describes an oj-c-button item in the Toolbar.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Specifies the desired toolbar item.

properties.name: key
properties.description: A unique key associated with the toolbar item.

properties.name: onAction
properties.description: Optional callback function associated with the toolbar item.

properties.name: display
properties.description: Display just the label, the icons, or all. Label is used as tooltip and should be set in all cases.

ojvalues.name: all
ojvalues.description: Display both the label and icons.

ojvalues.name: icons
ojvalues.description: Display only the icons.

ojvalues.name: label
ojvalues.description: Display only the text label.

properties.name: label
properties.description: Text to show in the button.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: Specifies that the button element should be disabled.

properties.name: tooltip
properties.description: Text to show in the tooltip. This overrides the default tooltip that renders the label when in icon mode.

properties.name: chroming
properties.description: Indicates in what states the button has variants in background and border.

ojvalues.name: ghost
ojvalues.description: Ghost buttons are the least prominent variation. Ghost buttons are useful for performing low-priority tasks, such as manipulating the UI.

ojvalues.name: borderless
ojvalues.description: Borderless buttons are a more prominent variation. Borderless buttons are useful for supplemental actions that require minimal emphasis.

ojvalues.name: outlined
ojvalues.description: Outlined buttons are salient, but lighter weight than solid buttons. Outlined buttons are useful for secondary actions.

ojvalues.name: solid
ojvalues.description: Solid buttons stand out, and direct the user's attention to the most important actions in the UI.

ojvalues.name: callToAction
ojvalues.description: A Call To Action (CTA) button guides the user to take or complete the action that is the main goal of the page or page section. There should only be one CTA button on a page at any given time.

ojvalues.name: danger
ojvalues.description: A Danger button alerts the user to a dangerous situation.

properties.name: startIcon
properties.description: Optional icon to render at the start of the button.

tstype.value: { type?: 'class'; class: string; }|{ type: 'img'; src: string; }

properties.name: endIcon
properties.description: Optional icon to render at the end of the button.

tstype.value: { type?: 'class'; class: string; }|{ type: 'img'; src: string; }

name: MenuSeparator
description: Specifies a menu separator: { type: "separator" }.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Specifies a separator menu item.

name: MenuItem
description: Specifies a standard menu item.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Specifies a standard menu item.

properties.name: label
properties.description: The menu item label.

properties.name: key
properties.description: A unique key associated with the menu item.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: Specifies if the menu item is disabled (enabled by default).

properties.name: onAction
properties.description: Optional callback function associated with the menu item.

properties.name: startIcon
properties.description: Optional icon to render at the start of the menu item.

tstype.value: { type?: 'class'; class: string; }|{ type: 'img'; src: string; }

properties.name: endIcon
properties.description: Optional icon to render at the end of the menu item.

tstype.value: { type?: 'class'; class: string; }|{ type: 'img'; src: string; }

properties.name: variant
properties.description: Specifies the menu item behavior.

name: MenuSubMenu
description: Specifies a menu item representing a submenu.

properties.name: key
properties.description: A unique key associated with the submenu menu item.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Specifies a submenu menu item.

properties.name: label
properties.description: The submenu label.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: Specifies if the submenu is disabled (enabled by default).

properties.name: startIcon
properties.description: Optional icon to render at the start of the submenu.

properties.name: items
properties.description: Specifies the array of menu items that make up the submenu.

tstype.value: Array<oj-c.Toolbar.MenuSeparator|oj-c.Toolbar.MenuItem|oj-c.Toolbar.MenuSubMenu|oj-c.Toolbar.MenuSelectSingle|oj-c.Toolbar.MenuSelectMultiple>

name: MenuSelectItem
description: Specifies a selectable item in a menu item.

properties.name: label
properties.description: The selectable item label.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: Specifies if the selectable item is disabled (enabled by default).

properties.name: endIcon
properties.description: Optional icon to render at the end of the selectable item.

tstype.value: { type?: 'class'; class: string; }|{ type: 'img'; src: string; }

properties.name: value
properties.description: The value associated with the selectable item.

name: MenuSelectSingle
description: Specifies a menu item representing a select single.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Specifies a select single menu item.

properties.name: key
properties.description: A unique key associated with the select single.

properties.name: items
properties.description: Specifies the array of select items that make up the select single.

tstype.value: Array<oj-c.Toolbar.MenuSelectItem>

name: MenuSelectMultiple
description: Specifies a menu item representing a select multiple.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Specifies a select multiple menu item.

properties.name: key
properties.description: A unique key associated with the select multiple.

properties.name: items
properties.description: Specifies the array of select items that make up the select multiple.

tstype.value: Array<oj-c.Toolbar.MenuSelectItem>
